Yes, there are many virtual tourism experiences available that allow people to explore Sri Lanka from the comfort of their own homes. Here are a few examples:

1. Virtual tour of Sri Lanka's cultural triangle - this virtual tour takes visitors on a tour of some of Sri Lanka's most famous cultural sites, including Sigiriya, Dambulla, and Anuradhapura.

2. Virtual Beach Tour - This tour brings the beach to you with immersive 360-degree views of some of Sri Lanka's best beaches.

3. Virtual wildlife safari - This tour takes viewers on a virtual safari tour of Sri Lanka's national wildlife parks, showcasing Sri Lanka's diverse wildlife.

4. Virtual cooking class - This cooking class takes participants through a guided cooking experience, teaching them how to create Sri Lankan dishes such as curry and rice.

5. Virtual Yoga Session - This session brings mindfulness to the forefront with a virtual yoga session, showing participants how to engage in authentic Sri Lankan yoga practice.

These experiences are available on various online tourism platforms and offer unique insight into the beauty and culture of Sri Lanka, even during the travel restrictions.
